snippet: Cumulative spending growth over the past three months suggests that the construction industry is recovering from the harsh winter.
abstract: Commerce Department reports that construction spending rose 0.2 percent in April, to seasonally adjusted annual rate of $953.5 billion.
lead_paragraph: Cumulative spending growth over the past three months suggests that the construction industry is recovering from the harsh winter.

headline.main: Construction Spending Reaches Its Highest Level Since 2009
headline.print_headline: Construction Spending Reaches Its Highest Level Since 2009
